title: Show latest known wallet balance when user is running app in offline
body:
### Description
_Type_: Bug

_Summary_: As user, I don't want to be shocked seeing zeros for my wallet balance when I suddenly lost connection. This happens because of current implementation - we are fetching balance automatically after certain period of time or when refreshing manually. So when I am offline - the app could not fetch anything and shows zeros which is confusing. 

#### Expected behavior
I suggest showing latest known wallet value when the user is offline so the user is not confused. and refresh it immediately when the connection is back and alive

#### Actual behavior


* Wallet shows `...` instead of balance when i open the app in offline.
* Assets are shown as zeroes

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28752642/40977719-6eb580a6-68da-11e8-985f-9ba6387c24d3.png)

### Reproduction


* Open Status
* Faucet some funds and check balance
* Go offline and check the balance

@asemiankevich Hi! Am not able to reproduce this, when I go offline the wallet balance is preserved and not zeroed. And the code in `update-wallet` in `wallet/events.cljs` checks the network status and does not update if offline:
```
     (when (not= network-status :offline)
```
Can you give more repro instructions? Thanks! :beers:  

(PS. Only exception is if I change currency while offline, but I don't think you were referring to that? Perhaps the option for that should be disabled?)

@pacamara i was not clear in the ticket - my bad! I meant that when i am offline and app was not running on the background - i open the app and it can not fetch anything from the api because there is no internet connection. so the case it:
- run status and get some funds
- check balance is updated
- go offline and close the app (app is not running on background)
- open the app (still being offline)
To be revoked if @asemiankevich confirms this is no longer relevant?

@pablanopete @andytudhope the issue is still there. 

- run status and get some funds
- check balance is updated
- go offline and close the app (app is not running on background)
- open the app (still being offline)

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done 

<hr>

__Workers have applied to start work__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 2 months, 2 weeks from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [oday0311](https://gitcoin.co/oday0311) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=oday0311) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=oday0311))_.**

1. store the last information to local storage of mobile, 
2. using the local storage information when the response of the request fail 
3. update the local storage when the query success.
**2) [leonardohof](https://gitcoin.co/leonardohof) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=leonardohof) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=leonardohof))_.**

Hi,

Can I work on the resolution of this Issue?
**3) [equwal](https://gitcoin.co/equwal) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=equwal) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=equwal))_.**

I think this is an interesting idea. However, my opinion is that is might be even worse to silently show outdated wallet data. Instead, I propose using the same display as the top one (currently an elipsis "..." ).

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/4391/1823).

Hi,

I was having a couple of problems setting my local dev environment, but now I'm ready to go. One question, I connected the app to the Rinkeby testnet to get some funds through the faucet, but once I've got some ETH, the wallet balance info always shows 0USD. What's the best testnet to reproduce this issue?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/926341/49059060-02141a00-f1d5-11e8-93f5-97853c0aa372.png)

@santteegt you are on correct network. alternatively you can use ropsten but there will be no difference. both networks will show 0 as test assets do not have any USD value. On the screenshot above you can see that when i go offline - i see three dots instead of 0 USD value (which will be always 0 now on test networks).

That one https://get.status.im/chat/public/status
Join the public chat: #status in Status
try to use #status-core. Or post the questions here. @goranjovic or @bhauman are the best persons to ask about wallet! :)

What I'm currently hesitating a little is about how you're currently managing to persist values in local storage (not in memory as app-db). Could you give me a reference to a `cljs` file where I can get some clear example?
